map.string: Used on consumables, define how much of the mass is converted when being eaten.
Used on omnivores, define how much of the mass is converted into food when something is eaten.
Used on carnivores, define how much of the mass is converted into food when something is eaten.
Used on herbivores, define how much of the mass is converted into food when something is eaten.
Used on plants, define how much of the mass is converted into food when nourishment is take from the parent.
Used on consumables to define whether they are meat or plant based.
For living things, the amount of 'food' contained in them. Nutrients are consumed to recover 'status' or to grow.
Used on consumers, to define the max amount of food mass their stomach can contains as a factor of their mass.
Used on flammable entities to determine how fast they burn.
A list of entities or archetypes which should be created when the entity is deleted. Handled by the DecaysInto trait.
An entity marked with this cannot be used by entities that have a lower level.
The level of the entity. This governs additional modifiers applied as well as which entities can be used.
Experience points. Scripts handle upgrading the entity to new levels as this increases.
The amount of experience points awarded for killing an entity.
Id of the other entity which last hit an entity. This is used for determining to whom XP should be rewarded.
The energy level of the entity. When stamina is zero some actions can't be performed.
Used by Spawner to determine the interval between checks.

Used by Spawner to determine locations where to create new entities. Each location is a map. Optionally a "pos" can be specified to define a position relative to the entity. Optionally a "loc" can be specified to refer to an entity (otherwise the entity to which the property belongs to is used). Optionally a "radius" can be specified to randomize position within a circle.
Used by Spawner to determine how many entities it should create.
Used by Spawner in "vicinity" mode to check for valid entities.
Used by Spawner in "vicinity" mode to determine the area it checks within.
Used by Spawner to create new entities. Contains an Entity specification.
Used by Spawner to keep track of the entities it has spawned, independent of where they are.
Used by Spawner to optionally disable.
Used by the Generic Craft mechanism to set the duration of the craft task, in seconds. Defaults to 5.0.

Used by the Generic Craft mechanism. A list of the ingredients needed to be present on the actor, which will be consumed. Each entry is a map containing a required Entity Filter as a "constraint" string, and an optional "amount" (defaults to 1).
Used by the Generic Craft mechanism. A list of entity declarations which will be created as a result of the crafting.
Used by the Generic Craft mechanism. An optional name of the thing(s) created. To be emitted as an Imaginary.
Put on entities that players shouldn't be allowed to move when they are planted in the 'land'.
Used in movement constraints to limit movement of too heavy entities.
Used together with "__spawn" property. Declared extra properties which will be installed on any new entities created at the spawn.
Used by the "Immortality" script to make an entity immortal. An "immortal" entity cannot be destroyed by normal means.
The max scale of an entity. This is a single value; when enforcing one dimension of the actual scale value will be used (often y).
Records the location into which the entity is spawned. This is used by NPCs to allow for rules where they wander close to where they are spawned.
